content.description: Downclimb to the small ledge below the trail on the north shoulder of the tower.  Climb pockets and slab past four bolts to a shared anchor.
content.location: This is the right-hand route on the Troll Wall.  Lower or rap from anchors.

content.description: This is the arete left of The Fisher King, ending at the anchors of the same.
content.location: Far end of the west (right-hand) wall in the corridor.  Move left from the start of The Fisher King and make a single interesting move around the arete to gain buckets all the way to the top.

content.description: The left route on the Troll Wall.  The best access to the start is to climb Working Class and lower down to the next lower level.  You can also boulder down from the belay of Working Class.  Climb the steep, pocketed face, staying to the left of bolt 3 to avoid ledgefall potential, and clip anchors shared with Working Class. Two new bolts (#1 and #3) were added to the three original hand-drilled bolts to ease this line oujt of the R/X category and back into G/PG status.
content.protection: 5 bolts, shared 2 bolt cold shut anchor.
content.location: Lower or rap from anchors, but please don't TR directly through any anchor at the Troll Hut, unless you plan on installing or leaving a pair of replacement rings for the FA party.

content.description: A steep pocket climb with a mental final crux, this is a fine jug haul for the moderate climber.  The run-out at the top seems intimidating, but after the mantle onto the ledge, it is a walk to the achors.
content.location: Located in the inner hallway, this line ascends the steep, pocketed face on the right, at the top of the west wall of the corridor.

content.description: This route starts from atop a balance flake of rock that has survived hours of belay and over a decade of use as a plateform.  Please don't be the buttnugget that decides to send this down the canyon, eliminating the rope platform and belay stance and increasing the length of the route by ab out 15 feet, instantly.
content.location: West wall of the inner hallway, the leftmost route on the wall (Resolution is the route to the right).

content.description: This is the small cluster of towers and faces that defines the southernmost development of Northern Devils (the power tower and the rest were developed a decade before and should be considered part of the picnic area or the sunburn crag).  It gets a bit of everything... morning sun, afternoon shade, shelter from the prevailing winter winds but enough summer breezes to survive all but the hottest days.
